title: othinus
body:
A Magic God that was based on Norse mythology Odin. Magic God are the purest, most perfect Magician that encompasses every possibility, including positive and negative (thus all her magic always has 50/50 chance of succeeding). She wield [[Gungnir_(Toaru)|Gungnir]] to cover her 50/50 weakness, and to remake the world.

[spoiler]At the end of her arc, she uses "Turn to Fairy" spell to undo her status as a Magic God and killing her. But due to [[kamijou_touma|Kamijou Touma's]] [[imagine_breaker|Imagine Breaker]] interrupting the magic, she survived the spell and turned into [[minigirl|15cm]] [[fairy]] who lost all of her magic.[/spoiler]

title: star_trek:_strange_new_worlds
body:
A 2022-present [[Star Trek]] show, a spin-off of [[Star Trek: Discovery]] and a prequel to the [[star trek: the original series|Original Series]]. 

It focuses of the crew of the [[uss enterprise ncc-1701|USS Enterprise]] seen in the original series, but before when it was under the command of captain [b]Christopher Pike[/b]. The show features many legacy characters such as [[Spock]] and [[Nyota Uhura|Uhura]] [spoilers](and later on [[montgomery scott|Scotty]])[/spoilers], while also introducing new ones like [i]La'an Noonien Singh[/i] (a descendant of the infamous [[Khan Noonien Singh]]) and [i]Erica Ortegas[/i].

title: kanzaki_kaori
body:
[[ToAru Majutsu no Index]] character.

An eighteen-year-old Japanese sorceress from Necessarius. Unlike her partner, [[Stiyl Magnus]], she uses magic to magically strengthen her body. Her sorcery name is Salvare000, "The one being saved becomes the hand that saves".

She uses a two-meter-long [[ootachi]]  called "Seven Heavens Seven Swords" as her weapon. She has a special attack called Nanasen that uses her sword and thin steel wires.

She used to be a kind woman who treated [[Index (toaru majutsu no index)|]] like a sister, but when Index's memories were deleted by Necessarius, Kaori changed into a cold and silent woman as Index no longer remembered her and consequentially did not trust her. After [[Kamijou Touma]] saves Index's life and her current memories, she decides to let Index stay at Academy City as she feels Touma can protect her.

h4. Tagging

* [b]Physical traits[/b]: [[very long hair]], [[ponytail]], [[black hair]], [[purple eyes]], [[large breasts]]
* [b]Clothing/accessories[/b]: [[tied shirt]], [[uneven legwear]], [[single pantsleg]], [[uneven sleeves]], [[jeans]], [[hair ribbon]], [[denim jacket]], [[midriff]]
* [b]Occasional tags[/b]: [[shichiten shichitou]], [[ootachi]], [[wire]], [[fallen angel ero maid costume]]

title: antoni_gaudi
body:
Antoni Gaudí (alternatively [i]Antonio Gaudí[/i]) was a renowned Spanish architect born in Catalonia. The maximum exponent in Spanish "Modernist":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Art_Nouveau] architecture, he is mostly remembered for his greatest work ― the [[Sagrada Familia]], which was designated as a World Heritage Site by the UNESCO in 2005. Others of his architectural designs also received this prestigious award.

 
 
[i]Beauty is the radiance of truth, and just as art is beauty, without truth there is no art.[/i]
－Antoni Gaudí

title: sagrada_familia
body:
A Catholic [[cathedral|basilica]] in Barcelona that is, as of 2023, the largest uncompleted one in the world. Designed by the Catalan architect [[Antoni Gaudi|Antoni Gaudí]], ground was broken for it in 1882, but due to various circumstances including construction stopping and starting, it is currently scheduled to be completed after 2026. However, UNESCO has designated it as a World Heritage Site and Pope Benedict XVI both consecrated it and named it a minor basilica.

H4. External Links

"Official Site (Spanish/Catalan/English)":[https://sagradafamilia.org/en/home]
other_names: サグラダ・ファミリア

title: two-face
body: Villain in [[Batman (series)|]]. He was once the district attorney of Gotham, [[Harvey Dent]], before his fateful transformation, wherein half of his face was doused with acid. Flips a [[coin]] to decide whether good or evil prevails in a given situation.

title: athletic_leotard
body:
A [[leotard]] worn for [[ballet]], [[gymnastics]], [[dancing|dance]], or other similar activities.

As these leotards are used for activities with a lot of movement the leotard either covers the shoulders or has a strap to prevent wardrobe accidents.  A strapless-like appearance may be achieved through the use of skin tone or see-through fabrics though.

For ballet and dance practices it is frequent that these leotards are worn with [[pantyhose|tights]] and typically feature flat colors.  For gymnastics it is most common that they're worn barelegged and it is not unusual for them to be made of a material featuring a sheen to them.

Official Gymnastic competitions have modesty rules for the appearance of the leotards worn by competitors.  While these do not bar someone from competing, violating it will immediately result in point deductions from their score.  The main restrictions on leotards are:

* May not be made of transparent material
* The neckline may be no lower than the sternum and the back may be no lower than the shoulder blades
* May not feature narrow straps
* The cut of the leotard at the top of the legs must not go beyond the fold of the crotch

title: tokyo_love_story
body:
[b]Tokyo Love Story[/b] is a Japanese manga written by [[Fumi Saimon]]. It was published by Shogakukan in Big Comic Spirits from 1989 to 1990 and collected into 4 tankōbon volumes.

Tokyo Love Story was adapted into a Japanese television drama in 1991 which aired on Fuji Television in 11 episodes and one special between January and March 1991. The television drama starred Yūji Oda, Honami Suzuki, and Narimi Arimori, and its theme song "ラブ・ストーリーは突然に":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Love_Story_wa_Totsuzen_ni] by singer Kazumasa Oda is the 9th best-selling single in Japan. A remake premiered on FOD (Fuji TV on demand) and Amazon Prime Video in 2020. 

h4. Synopsis

Nagao Kanji who comes from Ehime Prefecture joins Heartsports company located in Tokyo, where he met lovely and sunny [[Akana Rika]]. The love story begins.

h4. External links

* "IMDb entry (1991)":[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0206518/], "IMDb entry (2020)":[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt12494314/]
* "MAL entry":[https://myanimelist.net/manga/18894/Tokyo_Love_Story]
* "Wikipedia: Tokyo Love Story":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tokyo_Love_Story]

title: aac_honey_badger
body:
The [b]AAC Honey Badger[/b] is an [[AR-15]]–based compact [[assault rifle]], frequently used in a [[suppressor|suppressed]]. Chambered in proprietary .300 AAC Blackout cartridge, it was originally produced by Advanced Armament Corporation.

Both the [[gun]] and the cartridge used were developed in close co-operation with US Special Operations units to create an effective replacement for the MP5 and similar close quarters combat weapon systems.  

h4. See also

* [[Honey Badger (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

title: honey_badger
body:
The [b]honey badger[/b] (Mellivora capensis), also known as the ratel, is an omnivorous mammal widely distributed in Africa, Southwest Asia, and the Indian subcontinent.

The [[animal]] is characterized by its cylindrical body, non-prominent rounded ears, sturdy legs with five toes on each foot, and claws. Its coat color appears to be greyish beige on the upper half, and black below.

h4. See also

title: wheelie_(yume_nikki)
body:
A circular being found in the Number World.

There are four types of Wheelies, all of which share human-like legs and a wheel-shaped head:

* The first is red with facial features that most resembles a face out of the four. It starts out in the north-western corner of the map.
* The second is blue-green with some sort of design involving a [[ring]] connecting three [[diamond_(shape)|diamond shapes]] and surrounding a fourth. It spawns in the north-eastern corner of the map
* The third is dark pinkish with a [[one-eyed|single eye]]. Many instances of this type flood the Stabbing Room.
* The fourth is lime green with two [[red_pupils|red pupiled]], misshapen eyes placed diagonally from each other, and a splotch of some kind that may be a nose. It guards the door to the Stabbing Room. 

h4. External links

* "Yume Nikki Wiki: Wheelies":[https://yumenikki.fandom.com/wiki/Wheelies]

title: tabuk
body:
A 7.62×39mm, gas-operated Iraqi semi-automatic [b][[sniper rifle]][/b] which its design is based from a modified version of the [[Zastava M70]] [[assault rifle]]. 

It visually resembles the Zastava M72 light machine gun which is patterned after the [[RPK]]. The Tabuk is built on a RPK-style receiver that utilizes the long-stroke piston action of the [[kalashnikov rifle|AK]] and has many parts in common with the Zastava M70 [[rifle|series]]. The Tabuk [b]differs[/b] from the M72 in some other ways. It has a provision for mounting [[scope]]s, though this is not an unusual accessory on Eastern Bloc [[weapon]]s. Second one, a skeletonized fixed wooden buttstock with a cheek piece. A third difference, is the conspicuous lack of a [[bipod]]. 

h4. See also

* [[PSL Romak]]
* [[Tabuk (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tabuk sniper rifle":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tabuk_Sniper_Rifle]

title: joseon_dynasty
body:
[b]Joseon[/b] (조선; 朝鮮), officially [b]Great Joseon State[/b] (대조선국; 大朝鮮國), was the last dynastic kingdom of [[Korea]], lasting just over 500 years. The Joseon period has left a substantial legacy to modern Korea; much of modern Korean culture, etiquette, norms, and societal attitudes toward current issues, along with the modern [[Korean text|Korean language and its dialects]], derive from the culture and traditions of Joseon. Modern Korean bureaucracy and administrative divisions were also established during the Joseon period. 

It was founded by [[Yi Seong-gye]] in July 1392 and replaced by the [[Korean Empire]] in October 1897. The kingdom was founded following the aftermath of the overthrow of [[Goryeo]] in what is today the city of [[Kaesong]]. Early on, Korea was retitled and the capital was relocated to modern-day [[Seoul]]. The kingdom's northernmost borders were expanded to the natural boundaries at the rivers of Amrok and Tuman through the subjugation of the Jurchens. 

During its 500-year duration, Joseon encouraged the entrenchment of [[Confucianism|Confucian]] ideals and doctrines in Korean society. Neo-Confucianism was installed as the new state's ideology. [[Buddhism]] was accordingly discouraged, and occasionally Buddhists faced persecutions. Joseon consolidated its effective rule over the Korean peninsula and saw the height of classical Korean culture, trade, literature, and science and technology. In the 1590s, the kingdom was severely weakened due to the two failed Japanese invasions of 1592 and 1598. Several decades later, Joseon was invaded by the Later Jin dynasty and the [[Qing dynasty]] in 1627 and 1636–1637 respectively, leading to an increasingly harsh isolationist policy, for which the country became known as the "hermit kingdom" in Western literature. After the end of these invasions from Manchuria, Joseon experienced a nearly 200-year period of peace and prosperity, along with cultural and technological development. What power the kingdom recovered during its isolation waned as the 18th century came to a close. Faced with internal strife, power struggles, international pressure, and rebellions at home, the kingdom declined rapidly in the late 19th century.

h4. See also

* [[Korea]]
* [[Korean Empire]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Korean Empire":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseon

title: han_dynasty
body:
The [b]Han dynasty[/b] (汉朝) was an [[China|imperial dynasty of China]], established by [[Liu Bang]] and ruled by the House of Liu.

The dynasty was preceded by the short-lived [[Qin dynasty]] and a warring interregnum known as the Chu–Han contention, and it was succeeded by the [[ romance of the three kingdoms |Three Kingdoms period]]. The dynasty was briefly interrupted by the Xin dynasty established by usurping regent Wang Mang, and is thus separated into two periods—the Western Han and the Eastern Han. Spanning over four centuries, the Han dynasty is considered a golden age in [[Chinese Empire|Chinese history]], and it has influenced the identity of the Chinese civilization ever since. Modern China's majority ethnic group refer to themselves as the "Han people" or "Han Chinese". The [[Chinese text|spoken Sinitic language and written Chinese]] are referred to respectively as the "Han language" (汉语) and "Han characters" (汉字).

h4. See also

* [[China]]
* [[Chinese Empire]]
* [[Hanfu]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Han dynasty":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Han_dynasty

title: qin_dynasty
body:
The [b]Qin dynasty[/b] (秦朝) was the [[Chinese Empire|first dynasty]] of [[China|Imperial China]].

Named for its origin in the state of Qin, a fief of the confederal Zhou dynasty which had endured for over five centuries—until 221 BC, when it assumed an imperial prerogative following its complete conquest of its rival states, a state of affairs that lasted until its collapse in 206 BC. It was formally established after the conquests in 221 BC, when Ying Zheng, who had become king of the Qin state in 246, declared himself to be "Shi Huangdi", the first emperor.

h4. See also

* [[China]]
* [[Chinese Empire]]
* [[Qin Shi Huang]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Qin dynasty":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qin_dynasty

title: tang_dynasty
body:
The [b]Tang dynasty[/b] (唐朝), or the Tang Empire, was an [[Chinese Empire|imperial dynasty of China]] that ruled from 618 to 907, with an interregnum between 690 and 705.

It was preceded by the [[Sui dynasty]] and followed by the [[Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms]] period. Historians generally regard the Tang as a high point in [[China|Chinese civilization]], and a golden age of cosmopolitan culture. Tang territory, acquired through the military campaigns of its early rulers, rivaled that of the [[Han dynasty]].

h4. See also

* [[China]]
* [[Chinese Empire]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tang dynasty":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tang_dynasty

title: ming_dynasty
body:
The Ming dynasty, officially the Great Ming, was an imperial dynasty of China, ruling from 1368 to 1644 following the collapse of the [[mongolia|Mongol]]-led [[Yuan dynasty]]. The Ming dynasty was the last imperial dynasty of China ruled by the Han people, the majority ethnic group in [[China]]. 

Although the primary capital of [[Beijing]] fell in 1644 to a rebellion led by [[Li Zicheng]] (who established the short-lived Shun dynasty), numerous rump regimes ruled by remnants of the Ming imperial family—collectively called the Southern Ming—survived until 1662.

h4. See also

* [[China]]
* [[Chinese Empire]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ming dynasty":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ming_dynasty

title: daito_academy_school_uniform
body:
A [[school uniform]] in [[magia record: mahou shoujo madoka magica gaiden|Magia Record]], worn by the students of Daitou Academy in Kamihama City.

The female variant consists of a [[short dress|short]] [[black dress|black]] [[collared dress]], a [[black jacket|black]] [[cropped jacket]] with [[breast pocket|breast pockets]] forming [[short over long sleeves]], along with a [[red necktie|red]] [[cross tie]] and [[black footwear|black]] or [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]].

The male variant consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[shirt]], a [[red necktie|red]] [[necktie]] and [[black pants|black]] [[pants]].

h4. Notable students

* [[Anna Mel]] (accessorizes with [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]])
* [[Azumi Hagumu]] (has [[white sleeves]] rather than black; accessorizes with [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]])
* [[Izumi Kanagi]] (accessorizes with [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]])
* [[Izumi Sougetsu]] (male student; wears his [[untucked shirt|shirt untucked]] with [[sleeves rolled up]] and [[open collar]], and his [[loose necktie|necktie loose]]) 
* [[Kazari Jun]] (accessorizes with a [[grey hoodie|grey]]/[[blue hoodie|blue]] [[hood up|hood]][[hoodie|ie]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]])
* [[Mao Himika]] (wears [[red footwear|red]] [[sneakers]] rather than loafers; accessorizes with [[white socks|white]] [[ankle socks]])
* [[Sena Mikoto]] (accessorizes with [[grey pantyhose|grey]] [[pantyhose]])
* [[Yakumo Mikage]] (accessorizes with [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]])
* [[Yakumo Mitama]] (accessorizes with [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]])

title: valkyrie_(apex_legends)
body:
A playable legend from [[Apex Legends]], released as part of Season 9. She is the daughter of [[Viper (titanfall 2)|]],  [[Titanfall 2]]'s [[Northstar (titanfall)|]] Pilot boss. Her real name is [b]Kairi Imahara[/b] (今原カイリ).

Her launch featured several flirtatious voice lines when interacting with [[Loba (apex legends)|]], instantly making the duo a popular [[yuri]] pairing with fans.

Valkyrie has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[brown eyes]] (often changed to [[grey eyes|grey]] in anime-styled fanart). Her default outfit consists of an [[orange bodysuit]] with [[orange gloves]] worn under a metal [[breastplate]] and [[armored boots|metal]] [[thigh boots]]. In all her appearances she is equipped with a [[jetpack]] armed with [[missile pod]]s. Her heirloom weapon is the [[Suzaku (apex legends)|]].

She is one of the few legends who has an official casual outfit, which consists of a [[red jacket]] worn over a [[black sweater]] with [[black pants]] and a [[black belt]]. Often pictured wearing or holding a pair of [[aviator sunglasses]].

Valkyrie is voiced by "Erika Ishii":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erika_Ishii] in English and "Doi Mari":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%9C%9F%E4%BA%95%E7%9C%9F%E7%90%86] in Japanese.

title: menkata_(meme)
body: A meme originating from [[Yuzu-Soft]]'s game [[Sanoba Witch]]. [[Ayachi Nene]] is very excited to visit a ramen shop where she's wanted to eat for a long time. She wants to order a メンカタカラメヤサイダブルニンニクアブラマシマシ (menkatakarameyasaidaburuninnikuaburamashimashi) ramen and say it loud and clear. She's very surprised and slightly scared when she gets a large bowl of [[jirou (ramen)|jirou ramen]] she can hardly eat. The order is so strange it is thought to be a magic spell, but it comes from the actual way of ordering noodle firmness and free toppings at Ramen Jiro. The official translation of Nene's mystery ramen is "noodlesfirmspicydoubleveggyextraextragarlicoil" by NekoNyanSoft.
other_names: メンカタカラメヤサイダブルニンニクアブラマシマシ

title: full_service_(mazjojo)
body:
[[Bara]] [[visual novel]] by Herculion Games with [[Mazjojo]] as the lead illustrator. 

It follows the story of [[Tomoki Nakamoto]], a workaholic young adult who wanted a change in his life. He gets an invitation to visit the Full Service spa to take a break, after which he started visiting it more often. [[tomoki_nakamoto|Tomoki]] can choose a masseur each session, who can also evolve into his love interest.

The game was announced sometime between 2015 and 2016, and was released on February 22nd, 2020 on itch.io, followed by a [[steam_(platform) |Steam]] release on the 16th of March.

h4. Characters

title: mulne_(taimanin_series)
body:
Mulne (ミュルヌ) is a Succubus of the Dark World.
Mulne is cheeky and loving. She seeks the ideal "brother/sister" and screws with humans' memories to find the one. Mulne would never use her skills for evil, and only acts like it for selfish affection at best.

title: alpaca
body:
Alpaca (Vicugna pacos) is a domesticated species of South American camelid. It resembles a small [[llama]] in superficial appearance. The animal became popular after a Chinese meme became widespread, in which the writer claimed a photoshopped photo of an alpaca as the [b]"Grass Mud Horse"[/b] - [b]"草泥马 ([i]Cao Ni Ma[/i])"[/b].
In Japan, alpacas are popular since the mid-2000s irrespective of the Chinese movement.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article: 'Grass Mud Horse'":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grass_Mud_Horse
* "Wikipedia article: Alpaca":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alpaca

title: censored_symbol
body:
A symbol that is [[censored]] or replaced by a less offensive one. This is often done due to its offensive symbolism or certain laws.

A common example is the [[Iron Cross]] or [[Balkenkreuz]] that often serve as [[swastika]] substitute in many [[World War II]]-themed video games.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Censorship]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

title: twitter_x_logo

title: sig_mcx
body:
The [b]SIG MCX[/b] is a family of selective fire [[gun]]s designed and manufactured by [[SIG Sauer]]. The civilian legal models are available in semi-auto only. SIG designed the upper receiver to be compatible with standard [[AR-15]] and [[M16]] lower receivers with the help of an adapter.

This tag applies to all the prominent variants, such the original SIG MCX [[assault rifle]], the second generation SIG MCX Virtus, the short-barrelled SIG MCX Rattler, and the multi-caliber SIG MCX Spear (that can be 7.62mm NATO [[battle rifle]]).

h4. See also

* [[SIG MCX (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[SIG MPX]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: SIG MCX":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SIG_MCX

title: hayakawa_tazuna
body:
Character in [i][[Umamusume]][/i]. [[akikawa_yayoi_(umamusume)| Chairwoman Akikawa's]] secretary.

* !post #3076245

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] in a [[split ponytail]] and [[green eyes]]. She wears a green [[double-breasted]] [[skirt suit]] and a [[green_headwear|green]] [[bowler hat]] with a [[horseshoe ornament]].

[spoiler]Is probably a secret [[horse girl]], just like the chairwoman, due to her feats (a normal human being shouldn't be able to outrun a horse girl, let alone the best sprinters of Tracen Academy). Fans speculate that she is Tokino Minoru (a famous WW2 era horse) in a human guise. As if to highlight that point, the horseshoe ornament on her hat is to [b]the right side of her head[/b], on top of the fact that both her and Tokino Minoru's birthday is on May 2nd.[/spoiler]

h5. External links

* "Umamusume Official Character Bio: Hayakawa Tazuna":[https://umamusume.jp/character/hayakawatazuna]

title: akikawa_yayoi_(umamusume)
body:
Supporting character from [[Umamusume]]. Chairwoman of Tracen Academy.

* !post #5859827

[i]Smol[/i] (despite her implied age).  Has [[brown hair|chestnut hair]] with a [[white hair|white stripe]] running off center through her bangs and a conspicuous longer white hairlock from the left side of her head. Often depicted carrying a [[folding fan]] and wearing a [[sun hat]] with a horseshoe-shaped cutout on the brim and a blue ornamental rose in front, to the right side of her head. Usually has a black-and-white cat riding on top of her hat.

The Chairwoman has a distinctive speaking style; she tends to insert a lot of two-kanji idiomatic phrases (as full sentences) in her speech. This is usually reflected in English translations by using short, curt 1-2 word sentences.

While she was always important in the background of the game scenarios, it's only with the "Great Food Festival" scenario that she became able to personally contribute to the player's training as the host of that scenario.

Due to her color scheme and hat (and the cat riding on top of said hat, plus said cat's color scheme), fans have speculated that she is actually [spoiler]Northern Taste under a human guise.[/spoiler] As such, she is sometimes drawn [spoiler]as a [[horse girl]][/spoiler] with her hat off. [spoiler]Either way, the fact that the rose is near where [b]the right ear[/b] of a horse girl should be is important.[/spoiler]

h5. Associated characters
* [[Hayakawa Tazuna]] - Her secretary.
* [[Matikane Tannhauser (umamusume)|]] - ??? [spoiler]RL child[/spoiler]
* [[Satake Mei]] - Friend

h5. External links

* "Umamusume Official Character Bio: Akikawa Yayoi":[https://umamusume.jp/character/akikawayayoi]

title: ipod_shuffle
body:
A smaller version of the [[iPod]] with no display interface, just buttons for playback. Its earphone jack often also doubles as its charging/syncing port using a special USB cable with an earphone plug on one end.

* !asset #22596099: iPod Shuffle models

title: ipod
body:
The iPod is a [[digital media player]] from [[apple inc.|Apple Computer]]. This tag should not be used for generic digital media players that do not match the general iPod design.

h4. Types
* [[iPod Classic]]
* [[iPod Nano]]
* [[iPod Shuffle]]
* [[iPod Touch]]

h4. See also
* [[iPod ad]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: ipod_classic
body:
Refers to the original design of the [[iPod]] as it was first introduced in 2001. It has the large circular button interface which eventually developed into the Click Wheel which can be used for convenient scrolling. Although it boasts the largest storage for any [[digital media player]] (up to 160 GB), the eventual shortage of replacement parts and decreasing demand (no thanks to the easier usability of the touchscreen iPods, [[ipod Touch|Touch]] and [[ipod nano|sixth and seventh-generation Nanos]]) led to its discontinuation.

* !asset #22596031: iPod Classic models

title: ipod_nano
body:
A smaller-sized version of the [[iPod]], often with less storage space (at least 4 to 8 GB) and smaller, but still colorful screen. It had undergone changes over the years. The first five generations included the Click Wheel from the [[iPod Classic]]. The last two generations have touchscreen interfaces instead.

* !asset #22596034: iPod Nano models

body:

For Sony's more recent [[digital media player]]s also sold under the Walkman brand, see [[Digital Walkman]], while for the more recent [[cellphone]]s under the Walkman brand, please only use the [[Sony]] tag. title: shotgun
body:
A [[gun]] that fires [[shotgun shell|shells]] containing pellets, rifled slugs, or other munitions. Shotguns have short effective range but high close-range destructive power due to the spread of the pellets. Shotguns generally have smoothbore barrels for firing multiple projectiles at once or in quick succession. There are numerous types of shotguns in different designs and configurations, such as:
* [[double-barreled shotgun|double-barrelled shotgun]] [tn](traditionally [[break action]])[/tn]
* [[bullpup]]
* [[lever action]]
* [[pump action]]
* [[sawed-off shotgun|sawn-off shotgun]]
* [[underbarrel shotgun]]

h4. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[shotgun speedloader]]

title: kami
body:
Ambiguous tag.

"Kami" is related to Japanese homonymes listed below and sometimes used as a sort of [[pun]]. Its pronunciation with "rendaku rule":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rendaku is "-gami".

* 神 - a general term for god / deity / divine spirit. When written in romanized form, it often means [[shinto]] deities.
* 紙 - [[paper]]
* 髪 - hair (on the head)
* 噛み or 咬み - [[biting]]
* 加味 - seasoning, flavoring. Use specific tags for condiments ([[salt]], [[pepper (spice)|]], [[soy sauce]], etc.) or [[cooking]]
* Another reading for 上 (Ue, "above")
* An abbreviation for 上方 (Kamigata, "Kyoto-Osaka region")
* かみさん (Kami-san) - wife
* おかみさん (O-Kami-san) - landlady

h4.General tags

* [[Special Type 2 Launch Ka-mi]] ([i]Toku Ni-shiki Uchibi-tei Kami-sha[/i]) - [[Imperial Japanese Navy]]'s amphibious [[tank]]

h4.Characters

* [[Oomiya-no-me-no-Kami]] (Miya-chan) ([[Inari Konkon Koi Iroha.]]), based on a [[shinto]] goddess with "the same name":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%85%AB%E7%A5%9E%E6%AE%BF 
* [[Uka no Mitama no Kami]] ([[Nekogami Yaoyorozu]])
* [[Yatsu-no-kami]] / Yato-no-kami - "Snake deities":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yato-no-kami appearing in "Hitachi-No-Kuni Fudoki":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fudoki#T.C5.8Dkaid.C5.8D 
* [[Kami (justdubs)|]] ([[JustDubs]])
* [[Kami-sama (dragon ball)|]] ([[Dragon Ball]])

title: kami-sama_(dragon_ball)
body:
A [[Dragon Ball]] character

An alien from planet [[Namek]], arrived on Earth as an adult. Created Earth's [[Dragon Ball (object)|Dragon Balls]]. Served as the guardian of Earth, until merging with [[Piccolo]] during the Cell saga. Needed to separate from the evil in his heart before becoming the guardian of Earth, thus creating [[Piccolo Daimaou]].

title: otoyomegatari
body:
(lit. [i]A Bride's Story[/i])

A historical romance manga by [[Mori Kaoru]]. It was published by Enterbrain in the magazine fellows! and is so far collected in 3 tankōbon volumes. The manga is licensed in English in North America by YenPress. Volume 1 was released in a hardcover format in May 2011.

Set in Central Asia in a rural town near the Caspian Sea during the early 19th century, the story revolves around a young woman, [[amir halgal|Amir]], who arrives from a distant village across the mountains to marry [[Karluk eihon]], a boy 8 years her junior. The story unfolds among details of every-day family and community life. However, the peaceful atmosphere is disturbed when Amir's family demands to take her back to their village.

h4. Characters

* [[amir halgal|Amir Halgal]]
* [[karluk eihon|Karluk Eihon]]
* [[Pariya]]
* [[mahatbek eihon|Mahatbek Eihon]]
* [[balkirsh halgal|Balkirsh Halgal]]
* [[akunbek eihon|Akunbek Eihon]]
* [[Sanira]]
* [[Yusuf (otoyomegatari)|]]
* [[seleke eihon|Seleke Eihon]]
* [[Tileke]]

* [[Chalg]]
* [[Rostem]]

h4. See Also

title: arming_doublet_(southern_cross)
body:
[b][i]For arming doublet of the 15th century, use [[gambeson]]. See also "its wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gambeson].[/i][/b]

A fictional type of advanced [[military]] [[body armor]] from the [[Choujikuu Kidan Southern Cross]] [[mecha]] anime series from the 80s.

The [b]Arming Doublet[/b] is a type of modular, personal hard combat armor used by the different units in the army of the Southern Cross to defend the civilian population of planet Glorie.

There are several many types of customized Arming Doublets and each one is used according to the army unit that employs it. They can function as [[spacesuit]]s, [[pilot suit]]s, diving suits or even desert and cold weather operation suits. The shape of these armors also changes depending on the gender of the users and their body type.
other_names: アーミング・ダブレット

title: fn_herstal
body:
"Fabrique Nationale d'Herstal (French for: National Factory of Herstal)

[b]FN Herstal[/b] is a leading [[gun|firearms]] manufacturer located in Herstal, [[Belgium]], and is owned by the holding company Herstal Group which is owned by the regional government of Wallonia. It is currently the largest exporter of [[military]] [[weapon|small arms]] in [[Europe]]. Founded on 3 July 1889 by Henri Pieper.

title: fn_mk_46
body:
The Mk 46 (Mark 46) [b][[light machine gun]][/b] is the lighter weight variant of the [[M249 saw]] produced by [[FN Herstal]], primarily used by the [[United States]] special operations forces (SOF) since 2003. It has a four-sided rail system on the heat shield. The MOD 1 variant has a fixed polymer buttstock, while MOD 2 has adjustable telescopic one.

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[Mk46 (Girls' Frontline)]]

title: m60_(machine_gun)
body:
An American [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] 7.62×51mm NATO [[machine gun]], first adopted by the [[United States army]] in 1957. The M60 was widely used by the US military during the [[Vietnam War]]. Due to several design flaws, it was largely supplanted by the [[M240]] which is a derivative of the Belgian [[FN MAG]] and the light machine gun [[M249 saw]] SAW.

The M60 gained the nickname "The Pig" due to its bulky size and appetite for [[ammunition]]. The weapon is popularly depicted in many video games and war films like [[Commando (movie)|]], [[Full Metal Jacket]] and [[Rambo]]. 

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* [[M60 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: M60 machine gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M60_machine_gun

title: m249_saw
body:
The American-manufactured equivalent of the FN Herstal Minimi 5.56mm air-cooled, gas-operated light [[machine gun]]. Formerly designated the M249 SAW (Squad Automatic Weapon). The M249 has a quick-change barrel and is usually provided with a [[bipod]] and either a fixed or retractable buttstock. It can use linked [[ammunition_belt|ammunition belts]] or box magazines.

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M249_light_machine_gun
* "World.guns.ru article":http://world.guns.ru/machine/usa/m249-saw-e.html

title: fabarm_fp6
body:
The [b]Fabarm FP6[/B] is a 12-gauge [[pump action]] [[shotgun]] that was manufactured by the Italian firearms company Fabbrica Bresciana Armi S.p.A. and sold by [[Heckler & Koch]]. It was intended for civilian and law enforcement use. Produced since 1998. 

All FP6 shotguns are sold with a choke adjustment wrench, owners manual and a hard plastic vacu-formed impact case. Additional accessories available from H&K include an assortment of chokes, [[muzzle device|muzzle brakes]]/[[compensator]]s, [[magazine (weapon)|]] tube extensions, pistol grips and [[folding stock]]s. There is an adapter available for the receiver of the FP6 to allow use of [[Remington 870]] stocks.

A spiked black and purple FP6 is the signature [[weapon]] of [[haruka (blue archive)|Igusa Haruka]] from [[Blue Archive]].

h1. See also
* [[FP-6 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
h1. External links
* Wikipedia : "Heckler & Koch Fabarm FP6":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heckler_%26_Koch_FABARM_FP6]

body:
Instant on-the-spot photographs, which typically have a square photo inside a white rectangular frame. See [[polaroid camera]] for the camera itself.

Characters are often seen shaking early Polaroid instant photos to dry the ink or produce the image faster.  After the release of their sealed film packs, shaking the photos do nothing to speed the photo development and run the risk of ruining the image by creating unwanted bubbles in it if shaken too vigorously.

title: sonogami_rinne
body:
She is a character exclusive to the game [[Date a Live: Rinne Utopia]] and the novel version of the game.
Rinne has short, light pink hair, with part of her hair tied up in a braid. She has light brown eyes and is seen wearing a uniform with a sweater that has the logo of Raizen High School.

In her Spirit form, Rinne's hair length increases to the point where her braids reach a length approaching her legs. Her eyes turn into a more intense pink, almost red color. Her Astral Dress takes on the appearance of a purple clock with golden extensions on her shoulders and hips. The vast majority of her face is covered by a veil. At the top of her head, there is a decorated headdress with a golden emblem at the center.

She has a daughter with [[Itsuka Shidou|Shido]] and is [[Sonogami Rio|Rio Sonogami]].
She's the younger sister of [[Yatogami Tohka|Tohka]] and Ren and daughter of [[Takamiya Mio|Mio Takamiya]].

h4. External Links
* "Date A Live Wiki: Rinne Sonogami":https://date-a-live.fandom.com/wiki/Rinne_Sonogami

title: sonogami_rio
body:
She is a character exclusive to the game Date A Live Twin Edition: Rio Reincarnation and the novel version of the game.
Rio has long plum hair that reaches to her legs. She ties her hair with one single braid and has a bow at the top of her head. Her eyes have a deep color. While in her Astral Dress, Rio wears a lavish pinkish-red dress with a gold emblem on the center. The dress also contains a large robe that reaches her feet.

She's the daughter of [[Itsuka Shidou|Shido]] and [[Sonogami Rinne|Rinne Sonogami]].
She's the niece of [[Yatogami Tohka|Tohka]] and Ren and granddaughter of [[Takamiya Mio|Mio Takamiya]].

title: 2024_summer_olympics_opening_ceremony
body:
The opening ceremony of the [[2024 Summer Olympics]] in Paris, France was held on 26 July 2024, and featuring the performances headlined by Celine Dion and Lady Gaga.

However, the ceremony has gained notoriety and criticism for various absurd imagery. Most notably the performance of the French band [[Gojira (band)|]] which featured the depiction of [[Marie Antoinette]] holding her [[disembodied head]], and the section featuring [[drag queen]]s and a [[nude]] singer that was originally meant to reference the Feast of Dionysus but is instead being widely mistaken for a parody of [[the Last Supper]].

title: sapphire_panlogism
body:
Touhou Chouseisho  ~ Sapphire Panlogism (東方潮聖書 ～ Sapphire Panlogism) is a fan-made Touhou Project game made using the Touhou Danmakufu ph3sx shooting game engine, created by Team Urban Magic. The game features a 6-stage story mode, along with an Extra Stage and an After-Extra "Carrefour" Stage.

It is notable for an in-game portrait of Reimu, as shown below, which briefly spawned a short trend of redraws and memes.

title: flame_toys_windblade
body:
A [[model kit]] of [[Windblade]] from [[Transformers]], produced by [[Flame Toys]] and based on a design by [[Ban! (bansankan)|]].

It was first announced in 2019, however the initial design was met with controversy after the company posted prototype images to Twitter, and was met with a surge of comments claiming the figure design was oversexualized. The prototype images were soon removed from the company's social media pages, and in 2020 they posted concept art for a revised design more similar to Windblade's other appearances. Ban is still the designer for the new design.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2159425: Ban's original fanart
* !post #4097397: Initial design concept art
* !post #4097398: Initial design concept art
* !post #4022937: Revised design concept art

title: sigurd_wongraven
body:
Sigurd Wongraven (born 28 November 1975), also known as Satyr, is a Norwegian musician who is the vocalist, guitarist, bassist and keyboardist for the [[black metal]] band [[Satyricon (band)|]]. Best-known by his stage name, Satyr.

title: satyricon_(band)
body:
A Norwegian [[black metal]] band formed in Oslo in 1991. [[Sigurd Wongraven]] (Satyr) and Frost have been the band's core members since 1993. Satyricon was the first Norwegian black metal band to join a multi-national record label (EMI).

h4. External links

* "Official website":[https://www.satyriconofficial.com/]
* "Wikipedia: Satyricon (band)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satyricon_(band)]

title: black_metal
body:
An extreme subgenre of [[heavy metal]]. Its musical characteristics are [[screaming|shrieked]] vocal style, heavy use of distorted [[electric guitar|guitar]] riffs with tremolo picking in order to emphasize atmosphere, and lo-fi recording. Lyrical themes typically revolve around hatred, Satanism, [[heresy]], blasphemy, [[darkness]], Paganism, [[depressed|depression]], [[suicide]] or such.

[[Darkthrone]] and [[Mayhem (band)|]] are notable black metal bands.

Use this tag when a post shows reference to various black metal bands, their [[album cover]]s, [[real life]] musicians, as well as its popular culture depiction. 

h4. See also

* [[Rock (music)|]]
* [[Heavy metal]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Black metal":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_metal]

title: darkthrone
body:
A [[black metal]] band originating from Norway. Formed in 1987, the band started with the death metal genre under the former name [i]Black Death[/i]. In early 1991 they embraced the black metal style. The band lineup currently consists of Fenriz and Nocturno Culto.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Darkthrone":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Darkthrone]

title: nisemono_chuuihou_(vocaloid)
body:
[i]Warning of Impostors[/i] (ニセモノ注意報), also translated as [i]Impostor Advisory[/i], is the second uploaded song of [[Shuuen no Shiori Project]], produced by 150P. This song is based of [[B-ko (shuuen no shiori)|]]'s discovery of her doppelgänger.

This song was first released on NicoNico, uploaded on 10 June 2012, sung by [[IA (vocaloid)|]]. It is later released as such in the album Re:Houkago -Shuuen Game-. When it was rereleased in the Shuuen -Re:write- album, it was sung by [[Kagamine Rin]]. It was also released in the Shuuen -Re:act- album, sung by B-ko's voice actress, [[Touyama Nao]].

title: walkure_(macross_delta)
body:
A 5 member [[idol]] group from [[Macross Delta]]. Because the group's singing is capable of dampening the effect of the Vár syndrome, they are often deployed to perform at active battle zones. Their logo is a [[silhouette]] of Mikumo with [[butterfly wings]] and [[floating hair]]. They often do [[hand gesture|hand gestures]] in a "[[W]]" shape.

The name is used to refer to both the in-universe idol group, and the [[real life]] idol group comprised of the characters' [[voice actor]]s.

During the 2019 Macross Crossover Live event, [[Kawamori Shouji]] teased that a sixth member would be added to the group in the second movie based on the series, though it did not end up coming to fruition. Instead, the film debuted [[Yami Q Ray]] as a rival group to Walkure.

h4. Members

* !post #3390248: [[Mikumo Guynemer]] ([[JUNNA (singer)|]], [[Koshimizu Ami]])

title: titanfall_(series)
body:
A video game franchise developed by Respawn and published by EA. The series features a unique blend of fast-paced parkour-heavy combat on foot, and slower, more ability focused combat in the [[Titan (titanfall)|]] [[mecha]].

The series has two mainline entries and a mobile spinoff. The popular battle royale game [[Apex Legends]] is set in the same universe, but due to how it is largely treated as a separate entity,  Apex posts should not be tagged with this series unless they feature a direct crossover or reference beyond the shared weapons.

h4. Entries

* [[Titanfall]]
* [[Titanfall 2]]
* Titanfall Assault (Now-discontinued mobile game)
* Titanfall Online (Free-to-play MMOFPS adaptation of Titanfall 1 for the Asian market, canceled after a closed beta in South Korea)

title: sdkfz_251
body:
The [i]Sonderkraftfahrzeug 251[/i] [[half-track]] was a [[World War II]]-era German [[armored personnel carrier]] designed by the Hanomag company, based on its earlier, unarmoured "Sd.Kfz. 11":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sd.Kfz._11] vehicle. The Sd.Kfz. 251 was designed to transport the [i]Panzergrenadier[/i] (German mechanized [[soldier|infantry]]) into battle.

Some sources state that the Sd.Kfz. 251 was commonly referred to simply as ""Hanomags":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanomag]" by both German and Allied soldiers after the manufacturer of the vehicle; this has been questioned, and may have been only a postwar label. German officers referred to them as SPW ([i]Schützenpanzerwagen[/i], or armoured infantry vehicle) in their daily orders and memoirs.

h4. See also

* [[list of ground vehicles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sd.Kfz._251":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sd.Kfz._251]

title: heine_wittgenstein
body:
The protagonist of [[Oushitsu Kyoushi Heine]], the new royal tutor for the 4 Granzreich princes. Heine is an adult man with a childlike appearance, yet is very serious and doesn't show much emotion, except when being mistaken for a child. He has a multitude of talents, and is stern but kind towards his charges. Not much is known about his past, except that he apparently knew [[viktor von granzreich|the king]] long before he came to the palace to take up his duties, used to tutor at a church (he still does), and was a violent man in the past. 

He has [[red eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]] with [[parted bangs]]. His outfit includes [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[black pants]], [[brown vest]], [[black coat]], [[black necktie]], [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]] and [[black headwear|black]] [[hat|cap]] with a white [[tassel]] attached to it. He wears [[glasses]] and commonly holds a [[riding crop]].  

h4. External links

* "Oushitsu Kyoushi Heine Wiki: Heine Wittgenstein":[https://oushitsu-kyoushi-heine.fandom.com/wiki/Heine_Wittgenstein]

title: zentradi
body:
Usually the main antagonists in the [[MACROSS]] [[mecha]] anime franchise. An ancient [[space]]faring race of [[giant]] humanoid [[alien]] [[soldier]]s. 

They were created as proxy warriors by the first humanoid civilization in the galaxy, the [[Protoculture]], 500,000 years ago. They have been at war with the [[Supervision Army]] since then.

Physically, most of them resemble humans, though some have [[pointy ears]] and many diverse and unique skin, eye and hair colors. Prior to their first encounter with the human race, all members of the [b]Zentradi[/b] race were only reproduced and artificially fabricated through cloning.

The Zentradi army is a fearsomely powerful force of millions of space warships and mecha produced in thousands of huge and massive automated space factories scattered across the [[galaxy]] and legions of expendable giant clone troops created in mass production facilities.

Zentradi in giant form are called [[Maclone]]s, while their human sized variants are known as [[Miclone]]s. Female Zentradi are called [[Meltrandi]].

h4. Related tags

title: komillia_maria_jenius
body:
A fictional female character from the [[MACROSS]] science fiction franchise.

She first appeared in [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982 and also appears in the [[Pc Engine]] [[video game]]s [[Macross 2036]] and [[Macross: Eternal Love Song]] released only in Japan in 1992.

[b]Komillia Maria Jenius[/b] is the first daughter of [[Maximilian Jenius]] and [[Millia Jenius]]. Thus, she [b]is the first [[Zentradi]]/Human hybrid ever[/b].

title: garage_kit_(medium)
body:
Photos of real [[garage kit]]s. Unlike [[model kit (medium)|]]s, garage kits are typically premade static figures in very limited production runs that come unpainted and must be painted by the purchaser. Usually made of resin.

Garage kits are typically based on [[original]] characters or used as a way for fans to provide more risque unofficial figures of characters that wouldn't receive such figures officially. Some artists will 3D model and then physically mold and paint their own garage kits, even if they are not offered for sale to the public.

title: haniwa_(statue)
body:
Terracotta clay sculptures buried with the dead as funerary objects during the proto-historic "Kofun period":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kofun_period in Japan. Various types of haniwa were created, ~ soldier, [[horse]], [[dog]] and other [[animal]]s.
The haniwa soldiers wear ancient-style body armors, tentatively called "tankou":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%9F%AD%E7%94%B2] (lit. short armor) or "keikou":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%8C%82%E7%94%B2] (lamellar armor) by historians. They are not counted as [[Japanese armor]].

[[Hanny]], one of the [[monster]] tribes in the [[Alicesoft]] games are modeled on these haniwa figures.

They appear in [[Animal Crossing]] as [[gyroid (animal crossing)|]]s.

In [[Blue Archive]], haniwa exist as skill level up materials. Strangely, they're bright pink and resemble a sex toy.

h4.See also
* [[doguu]]
* [[doll]]
* [[figure]]
* [[Ooi! Hanimaru]]

h4.External links
* "Wikipedia: Haniwa":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haniwa

body:

The story revolves around a unique ability called "Reincarnation," which allows individuals to inherit the memories and skills of famous historical figures. These reincarnated individuals, known as "Returners" possess extraordinary abilities called as "talent" due to their past lives.

title: return_of_the_mount_hua_sect
body:
The [b]Return of the Mount Hua Sect[/b] (화산귀환), is a Korean webnovel, which recently released a manhwa/webtoon adaptation.

h4. Synopsis

The 13th disciple of the Great Mount Hua Sect. One of the Greatest Third-Generation Swordsmen. The Plum Blossom Sword Master, [[Chungmyung]].

After slicing the head of the peerless Heavenly Demon, who threw the world into chaos, he slept an eternal sleep on the peak of the Hundred Thousand Great Mountains. Jumping over a hundred years, he comes back in the body of a child.

title: shin_sakura_taisen
body:
A reboot of the [[Sakura Taisen]] franchise, known simply as [i]Project Sakura Wars[/i] during development, and released for [[PlayStation 4]] on December 12, 2019. The game is set 12 years after [[Sakura Taisen V]], and features an entirely new main cast, as well as real time action gameplay instead of the series' usual turn-based strategy gameplay. An anime series set shortly after the game's events began airing on April 3, 2020.

The game was released overseas on April 28, 2020. Due to the fact that the majority of the franchise had never been released outside of Japan, it was renamed to simply [i][b]Sakura Wars[/b][/i] in foreign markets.

[[Kubo Tite]] is the official character designer for the main cast, with guest artists providing designs for supporting characters.

title: titanfall
body:
The first game in the [[Titanfall (series)|]] series, released for [[computer|PC]] and [[Xbox One]] on March 11, 2014 and later ported to [[Xbox 360]] on April 8. Often retroactively known as Titanfall 1. The game does not feature a traditional campaign, instead, the story is told through multiplayer matches with short cutscenes at the beginning and end, as well as relevant dialogue from major characters during the matches.

Respawn Entertainment removed the game from online storefronts on Xbox, Steam, and Origin in December 2021, and announced that the game would be removed from subscription services (Xbox Game Pass and EA Play) on March 1, 2022. The game's servers will remain online for owners of the game.

This tag is for the original 2014 game only. For the series as a whole, see [[Titanfall (series)]].

h4. Characters

title: yunhua_lu
body:
A character in [[Kanata no Astra]].

A shy, quiet girl who constantly apologizes for everything she does. [spoiler]This is a result of being emotionally suppressed by her mother.[/spoiler] Her mother, Lucy Lum, is a world-famous singer. Yun-Hua has a great singing voice, but her mother constantly berated her and told her she should not bring attention to herself, so she distanced herself as much as possible.

title: funicia_rafaeli
body:
A character in [[Kanata no Astra]].

[[quitterie_rafaeli|Quitterie]]'s adopted sister, [spoiler]who was adopted into the family after the death of her parents.[/spoiler] She is a cheerful, positive girl who wants to get along with [[quitterie_rafaeli|Quitterie]].

She carries around a [[puppet]] named Beego with her.
other_names: フニシア・ラファエリ

title: quitterie_rafaeli
body:
A character in [[Kanata no Astra]].

A rich heiress who is the daughter of a famous doctor. She finds it difficult to trust other people besides Zack, who is her childhood friend. She received very little attention from her mother.

She has an adoptive younger sister, [[funicia_rafaeli|Funicia]].
other_names: キトリー・ラファエリ

title: ulgar_zweig
body:
A character in [[Kanata no Astra]].

A quiet, antisocial, but highly intelligent boy who does not get along well with the rest of the crew. His father is the vice-principal of Caird High. He's good at handling a gun. His late older brother was a freelance journalist who stumbled upon a secret he shouldn't have which resulted in his death, leading Ulgar to despise and hold revenge against Marco Esposito, [[luca_esposito|Luca Esposito]]'s father.
other_names: ウルガー・ツヴァイク

title: combination_gun
body: A [[gun]] with multiple barrels of different types and calibers, usually one or two [[shotgun]] barrels and one or two [[rifle]] barrels. Almost always [[break action]]. Resembles a multi-barrel shotgun, but usually distinguishable by the different width of the barrels and, if the view provided by the image permits, the lack of [[rifling]] in some of them.

title: vignette_tsukinose_april
body:
A character from the anime [[gabriel_dropout|Gabriel Dropout]]. Just as [[gabriel tenma white|Gabriel]] is an angel working in the human world under the guise of a high school student, Vignette is a demon doing the same thing, and the two are good friends.

Vigne is everything Gab is supposed to be: sweet, good-natured, and generous, to the point where it affects her salary as a demon. How Hell managed to produce her is the biggest mystery of the series.

Voiced by [[Oonishi Saori]].

h4. External links

* "Gabriel Dropout Wiki: Vignette April Tsukinose":https://gabdro.fandom.com/wiki/Vignette_April_Tsukinose

title: typhoon_devil_(chainsaw_man)
body:
[[Chainsaw Man]] character.

The Typhoon Devil is a devil that embodies the fear of [[typhoon]]s. It is the secondary antagonist of the Bomb Girl arc.

The Typhoon Devil is subservient and respectful towards [[Reze (Chainsaw Man)|]] and willingly cooperates with her for its own protection.

The Typhoon Devil's true form resembles a gigantic humanoid surrounded by a swirling storm of brain matter with the top part of its head exposed revealing more brain matter which is connected to the storm around it. In [[Mitaka Asa]]'s flashback, his face is that of an old man with a thick mustache.

The second incarnation of the Typhoon Devil has the face of a baby instead of an old man with a thick mustache.

body:
A Japanese [[bar (place)|]]. Comes in a variety of styles, but the most well-known has the patrons sitting or standing near the [[bar (place)|]], with wooden [[menu]] boards on the walls. title: sekai_no_yamachan
body:
An [[izakaya]] bar based in Nagoya, Japan that serves Tebasaki (Japanese chicken wings). Has a number of stores under its banner throughout Japan, as well as in Hong Kong, Thailand, Taiwan, and Malaysia. Its iconic mascot character, [[toriotoko_(sekai_no_yamachan)|toriotoko]], is one of the icons of Nagoyan food culture.

title: atom:_the_beginning
body:
Prequel manga spinoff of [[Tetsuwan Atom]], focusing on [[Tenma Umatarou]] and [[Professor Ochanomizu]] in their youth as they attempt to develop a robot with true autonomy.

* [[Mars (atom: the beginning)|]]

h6. Humans

title: soonie_(eversoul)
body:
An obtainable character in [[Eversoul]], belonging to the Beast faction. She is the Soul of the "Turtle Ship":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turtle_ship], the ship type utilized by the decorated Korean admiral "Yi Sun-sin":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yi_Sun-sin] in his battles against the Feudal Japanese navy.

She is an antiquated [[rabbit girl]] who serves as a naval commander in the nation of Gaon. Her adult-like mannerisms, experiences, and combat prowess are often overshadowed by her childish and petty behavior, a point of interest for many Souls within her friend group, and a source of teasing from her closest friend [[Jiho_(eversoul)|]].

She is a [[pink_hair|pink-haired]], [[red_eyes|red-eyed]] girl of short stature. Said hair is relatively [[long_hair|long]] for her height, and atop her head are her two [[rabbit ears]] that move accordingly depending on her mood and a small [[turtle]] resting on a [[hair ornament]]. She usually dresses in [[hanbok]], featuring a black [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] top and a long and wide [[blue skirt]], followed by a pair of child-like [[blue_footwear|blue]] [[boots]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6038426

title: sad_cat_dance_(meme)
body:
A dance [[meme]] originating from post #5613805, based on "an interpretation of a scene":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eL_vd2Xcqu4] (post #4934981) in [[Chainsaw Man]]. 

In chapters 85 and 86, [[Higashiyama Kobeni]] is working in a family restaurant when the [[Chainsaw Devil]] arrives. Through a combination of misunderstandings and clumsiness on Kobeni's part, the Chainsaw Devil proceeds to kill her customers and coworkers, then takes a crying Kobeni on a date, culminating in making her play [[Dance Dance Revolution]] while sobbing and getting a perfect score.

In the memetic format, one character hands cat costume items to another, then silently begs (to the point of kneeling so low they stand on their head) until the other puts them on and starts dancing, usually [[blush]]ing and [[sobbing]]. The tune used in the memetic format is a portion of "a sped-up version of the mashup tune [i]Gypsy in My Mind[/i] by Never Dull":[https://youtu.be/bmorUXjaQgs?t=101] that contains the remix of "[i]Gypsy Woman[/i] by Crystal Waters":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_KztNIg4cvE] (hence 'Gypsy' in the title) and "[i]The Bomb! (These Sounds Fall into My Mind)[/i] by The Bucketheads":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=no1vf854aUc], which in turn samples several opening bars and the line "Street sounds swirling through my mind..." (misheard as "These sounds fall into my mind") from "[i]Street Player[/i] by Chicago":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HJMw8cUGjwI].

h4. Examples

* !post #5613805: Origin

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Sad Cat Dance":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/sad-cat-dance]

title: goonya_monster
body:
Goonya Monster is a Japanese party game developed by MUTAN and the second entry in the Goonya series after Goonya Fighter. The game features artwork and character designs by illustrator [[Terada Tera]] and music by popular Japanese bands such as [[fake_type|FAKE TYPE]] and Sakanamon. In Goonya Monster busters have to kill enemies and collect their souls to place them in a "Soul Pot" while outrunning a player-controlled Monster.

title: quanxi_(chainsaw_man)
body:
Quanxi, also known as ‘The First Devil Hunter’, is a hybrid of the [[Crossbow Devil (Chainsaw Man)|]], former Japanese Devil Hunter, and infamous assassin from China.

Quanxi worked as a Devil Hunter in Japan and became known as the 'First Devil Hunter'. While working as a Devil Hunter, Quanxi was partnered with [[Kishibe (Chainsaw Man)|]] while he was a young and new Devil Hunter. Upon their first meeting, [[Kishibe (Chainsaw Man)|]] flirted with and asked her to become his woman. This was followed by her immediately slapping him across the face and soundly rejecting him. This same cycle would repeat over the next 9 years, until she realized she was interested in girls to which [[Kishibe (Chainsaw man)|]] admitted to having already known.

At some point in time after this, she left Japan and moved to China to begin work as an assassin for the Chinese government. She formed a harem of 4 female Fiends ([[Quanxi's Group (Chainsaw Man)|]]) either before or after moving to China.

She is able to transform into a hybrid of the [[Crossbow Devil (Chainsaw Man)|]], triggered by pulling a crossbow bolt out of her right eye.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7089264

h4. [[Quanxi's Group (Chainsaw Man)|]]

* [[Cosmo (Chainsaw Man)|]]

* [[Long (Chainsaw Man)|]]
* [[Tsugihagi (Chainsaw Man)|]]

title: bloodhound_(apex_legends)
body:
Playable legend in [[Apex Legends]]. A hunter from Talos who has canonically won the Apex games several times.

Bloodhound's default appearance consists of a [[fur trim|fur trimmed]] [[brown jacket]], [[brown pants]] with [[knee pads]], [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]], and [[red gloves]], with their face obscured by a [[rebreather]], [[goggles]], and [[helmet]]. Their appearance leaves their gender visibly [[ambiguous gender|ambiguous]], though they are officially stated as [[1other|non-binary]]. Little is known of Bloodhound's appearance under the mask, only that they are [[scar|scarred]] from exposure to coolants.

Bloodhound's favorite weapon is the [[charge rifle]] and their heirloom is the [[Raven's Bite]]. They are often seen with a [[crow]] companion named Artur and are romantically involved with [[Fuse (apex legends)|]] as of Season 15.

Voiced by [[Allegra Clark]] in English and "Kinoshita Sayaka":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9C%A8%E4%B8%8B%E7%B4%97%E8%8F%AF] in Japanese.

title: anvil
body:
A basic metalworking [[tools|tool]] consisting of a heavy [[metal]] block (typically steel or iron) with a hard surface on which piece of metal is shaped, or [[hammer]]ed. Anvils are used by metalsmiths (such as [[blacksmith|blacksmiths]]) in forging.

The most well known shape for an anvil is the "London Pattern," which has the key features of: a horn, a step, a face, a hardy hole, and a pritchel hole.

title: mk48
body:
The [b]Mk 48[/b] (Mark 48) is a belt-fed general-purpose [[machine gun]] chambered in 7.62×51mm NATO. The weapon was designed in the early 2000s, following a request from United States Special Operations Command for a replacement for the [[M60 (machine gun)|]].

It is manufactured by Fabrique Nationale Manufacturing Inc., a division of [[FN Herstal]] based in the [[United States|US]].

title: kisaragi_shintarou
body:
A main male character of [[Kagerou Project]] and [[Mekakucity Actors]]. He seventh member of Mekakushi Dan, and the older [[brother and sister|brother]] of [[Kisaragi Momo]]. In the anime, he is voiced by [[Terashima Takuma]].

Shintarou has [[black eyes]] and [[black hair|black]] [[short hair]]. His default outfit consists of a single-striped [[red jacket|red]] [[track jacket]] with [[popped collar]] that is usually [[open jacket|open]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[t-shirt]], and [[brown pants]].

h4. Main songs

* [[Children Record_(vocaloid)|]]
* [[Jinzou Enemy_(vocaloid)|]]
* [[Loss Time Memory_(vocaloid)|]]
* [[Summertime Record_(vocaloid)|]]
* [[Toumei Answer_(vocaloid)|]]

title: sig_p220/p226
body:
The [b]P220[/b] a semi-automatic [[handgun]] developed in 1975 and manufactured by [[SIG Sauer]], available in various caliber such as 9×19mm and .45 ACP. It features a decocking lever and a squared-off trigger guard. 

The [b]P226[/b] is basically the major variant of P220 with same mechanism and external appearance, but adopted to use double-stack [[magazine (weapon)|]] instead of earlier single-stack one. 

This tag also applies to the smaller variant of the P220, [b]P225[/B].

h4. See also

* [[P226 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "IMFDb":https://www.imfdb.org/wiki/SIG-Sauer_P220_pistol_series
* "Wikipedia: SIG Sauer P220":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SIG_Sauer_P220
* "Wikipedia: SIG Sauer P226":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SIG_Sauer_P226

title: a-ya_(shuuen_no_shiori)
body:
One of the main male characters from [[Shuuen no Shiori Project]]. 

He has slightly [[unkempt]] [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with an [[ahoge]], and [[red eyes]]. [[Bags under eyes|Bags under his eyes]] are sometimes visible, and his hair may [[hair between eyes|extend between his eyes]]

His [[school uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[black sweater]] over it, a [[red necktie|red]]-[[white necktie|white]] [[two-tone necktie]]. Over them he wears a [[blazer]] with [[red trim]]s and a [[school emblem]] on the left breast of the blazer. Underneath, a [[red pants|red]]-[[black pants|black]] [[plaid pants]].

His [[casual]] outfit consists of a [[white shirt]] underneath a [[black hoodie|black]] or [[purple hoodie]] with white stripes on the side and [[black pants]]. 

h4. External links

* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: A弥":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/A弥]
* "Shuuen no Shiori Project Wiki: A-ya":[https://shuuen-no-shiori.fandom.com/wiki/A-ya]

For holding unworn clothes, see [[holding unworn clothes]].

For holding clothes up or down while wearing them, see [[clothes lift]] or [[clothes pull]] respectively.

title: d-ne
body:
One of the female main protagonists of [[Shuuen no Shiori Project]]. She had her debut in the [[song name|song]] [[saru mane isu tori game (vocaloid)|Saru Mane Isu tori Game]].

D-ne has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] ([[black hair|black]] in the novels) and [[blue eyes]] ([[black eyes|black]] in the novels). [spoiler]After acquiring the Monkey's Paw and wishing for [[b-ko (shuuen no shiori)|B-ko]]'s red (often depicted as [[blue ribbon|blue]]), she cuts her hair [[short hair|short]]. And further uses her wishes to obtain eyes identical to B-ko's.[/spoiler]

Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with a  [[purple sweater]] over it, [[red necktie|red]]-[[white necktie|white]] [[two-tone necktie]]. Over them she wears [[white jacket|white]]/[[yellow jacket|yellow]] [[blazer]] with [[red trim]], decorated with a [[school emblem]]. Similar to [[C-ta]], she wears her blazer completely [[unbuttoned]]. She also wears a [[red skirt|red]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]] or [[black pantyhose]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

h4. External links

* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: D音":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/D音]
* "Shuuen no Shiori Project Wiki: D-ne":[https://shuuen-no-shiori.fandom.com/wiki/D-ne]

title: mpi-aks-74
body:
The MPi-AKS-74 is the [[East Germany|East German]] variant of the [[AK-74]] [[assault rifle]]. It has a longish [[muzzle device]] and a coat hanger-shaped [[folding stock|side-folding stock]] instead of triangular one.

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Wieger StG-940]]

title: binder_clip
body:
A device used to bind multiple sheets of [[paper]]. It is a piece of hard but elastic sheet metal shaped into triangular shape with curled edges and flippable handle. 

Not to be confused with smaller, wire-like [[paperclip]]. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Binder clip":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binder_clip

title: family_crest
body:
A [[crest]] used as a symbol of various clans/families in Japan. Especially one with considerable amount of influence within their region or the entire country. Also referred outside of Japan as "mon" (紋), though the word [i]mon[/i] is used to refer to any crest in general in Japan.

h4. Japanese family crests (kamon)

* !asset #20257814: [[Kikumon]], crest of the Imperial family of Japan
* !asset #20634855: [[kirimon (paulownia)|Kirimon]], crest of the Toyotomi clan, now the government seal of Japan
* !asset #20258334: [[mitsuba aoi (tokugawa mon)|Mitsuba Aoi]], crest of the Tokugawa clan
* !asset #20258593: [[Oda Uri]], crest of the Oda clan
* !asset #20258893: [[Mitsu Uroko]], crest of the Hojo clan
* !asset #20258790: [[Yotsuwari-bishi]], crest of the Takeda clan, also known as Takeda-bishi
* !asset #20257911: [[sanada clan (emblem)|Mutsurensen]], crest of the Sanada clan

h4. See also

* [[Heraldry]] - European counterpart of family crest

title: masking_tape_(medium)
body: Masking tape art is a type of art which makes use of strips of masking tape as an [[unconventional media|unconventional]] tool for artistic production. The type of tape most often used is a patterned tape known as washi tape (和紙テープ). The artist may construct their art entirely from masking tape or only use it for colors or patterns.

title: saionji_rin_(crh380b)
body:
[[Personification]] of "China Railways CRH380BL":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China_Railway_CRH3#CRH380B.2FBL], created by "SOSG":[http://baike.baidu.com/view/907043.htm]. Her prototype design is a personified CRH3C. She also works as "Tianwen Kadokawa":[http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/encyclopedia/company.php?id=10751] Harbin's mascot character. 

Rin has dark [[long hair]], and wears a blue [[hairband]], [[star (symbol)|]]-shaped [[hair_ornament|hair ornaments]], [[maid]] uniform and [[maid_headdress|headdress]]. 

She is not a [[mecha musume]], because she is generally regarded as an engineer/train operator.

title: kalar_(race)
body:
A race of [[elf]]-like humans who appear in the [[Rance (series)|]], [[Toushin Toshi]], and [[Evenicle (series)|]] series.

They are an all female race (with the exception of [[Kesselrink]], who became male after becoming a Dark Lord).

They are known for their [[pointy ears]], [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]], and a large, red [[jewel]] embedded in their foreheads (which turns blue after they lose their virginity). The only exception is [[Hunty Kalar]], who instead possesses [[black hair]] and [[yellow eyes]].

The [[angel]] [[Labelcase]] from [[Toushin Toshi II]] is notable for bearing a strong resemblance to the Kalar, but is not considered a member of the species.

h4. Notable Kalar

* [[Pastel Kalar]]
* [[Aegis Kalar]]
* [[Reset Kalar]]
* [[Modern Kalar]]
* [[Hunty Kalar]]
* [[Claire Kalar]]
* [[Remedia Kalar]]
* [[Bonny Kalar]]
* [[Kesselrink]] (formerly)

title: kirby:_star_allies
body:
A [[kirby_(series)|Kirby]] game for the [[Nintendo Switch]]. This is the latest in the "Return to Dream Land" series of games with the safe approach of traditional gameplay mechanics. The main attraction here is an expanded-upon co-op experience that allows up to three additional players to join in as Kirby recruits friends to his team with the new Friend Heart.

[[Kirby]] wakes up one day to notice that [[King Dedede]] is stealing food from Dream Land once again. Knowing that something is wrong with this picture, he immediately sets out to investigate. What follow is one of the grandest adventures he's ever been on, with the help of a lot of friends both old and new!

title: kirby's_dream_land_2
body:
A direct sequel to [[Kirby's Dream Land]]. 

One day, a new threat called [[Dark Matter (kirby)|]] ruins the Rainbow Bridges connecting the Rainbow Islands and possesses [[King Dedede]] to try to take over Dream Land. Once again, it's up to [[Kirby]] to make things right. This time, he has some help in the form of his animal friends [[Rick (kirby)|]], [[Coo (kirby)|]], and [[Kine (kirby)|]].

title: gundam_build_divers_re:rise
body:
The sequel to [[Gundam Build Divers]]. It follows an entirely new cast and has a notably different tone from the original.

The series takes place 3 years after the original Build Divers and follows a misfit team of GBN players who take on a mysterious mission that takes them to an unknown area of GBN that is notably unlike anything else in the game [spoiler]and later revealed to be a faraway planet called Eldora[/spoiler], where a race of [[furry|furries]] are being hunted by machines known as the One-Eyes.

title: ruined_king:_a_league_of_legends_story
body: A 2021 [[League of Legends]] turn-based single-player RPG first announced in 2019 with a character trailer on Halloween 2020 on the day of the Worlds Final. Made by Airship Syndicate as part of Riot Games' Riot Forge project allowing other developers to produce titles based on League and other games. The announcement trailer also marked the first appearance of [[Viego (League of Legends)|Viego]] as the titular Ruined King. h4. title: problem_solver_68_(blue_archive)
body:
Problem Solver 68 is one of the clubs at Gehenna Academy in [[Blue Archive]].

A club notable for taking "fixer contracts" and conducting other illegal business. Its members are usually on the run from the [[Prefect Team (blue archive)|]], and sometimes even the [[Justice Task Force (blue archive)|]].

The number 68 is believed to be derived from the first two characters (陸八) of Aru's family name, Rikuhachima (陸八魔).

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.

title: zip_22
body:
A [[handgun]] chambered for .22 caliber rounds produced by the US Firearms Manufacturing Company (USFA), which prior had been known for its high-quality [[Colt Single Action Army]] replicas.

The Zip .22 was intended to be the "world's safest gun", but proved disastrous between poor ergonomics, extensive feeding issues, and needlessly complex operation. The gun's failure would bankrupt USFA while the weapon itself would become the butt of jokes among firearms enthusiasts everywhere.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: USFA ZiP .22":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USFA_ZiP_.22

title: seminar_(blue_archive)
body:
Seminar is the Student Council for the Millennium Science School in [[Blue Archive]].

The group originally began as a team of researchers attempting to solve the seven "Millennium Problems" that would eventually give their school its name. Eventually, as the scope of their project crept outward and into other areas of research, Millennium was founded and Seminar has taken a place as its executive committee.

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.

h4. Members

* [[Noa (blue archive)|]]

* [[Koyuki (blue archive)|]]

title: after-school_sweets_club_(blue_archive)
body:
After-School Sweets Club is one of the clubs at Trinity General School in [[Blue Archive]].

The club's goal is to find and eat any notable or popular sweets and desserts. They're consider the opposite of the [[Gourmet research society (blue archive)|Gourmet Research Society]], as unlike their Gehenna counterparts, the Sweets Club do not destroy restaurants and food stalls they dislike.

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.

While [[Reisa (blue archive)|Uzawa Reisa]] often appears with the group, she is not a part of the club.

h4. Members

* [[Yoshimi (blue archive)|]]
* [[Airi (blue archive)|]]
* [[Kazusa (blue archive)|]]
* [[Natsu (blue archive)|]]

title: justice_task_force_(blue_archive)
body:
In [[Blue Archive]], Justice Task Force is one of the School Clubs of Trinity General School.

It is nominally a self-governing police force and service organization of Trinity General School, but in reality serves as the Armed Forces of Trinity and are affiliated with the [[Tea Party (blue archive)|]]. There are three or four main members of the club that are emphasized in the story, supported by numerous "mob" characters.

Their outfit of jet [[black serafuku]] & [[red neckerchief]], [[black wings|black]] [[feathered wings]], red [[halo]], and [[black choker]] is a stark contrast to the lighter-colored students at Trinity.

While [[Koharu (blue archive)|]] was briefly suspended from this group, she was re-instated after certain story events and continues to work for the force.

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all or most members of the group are present and are in focus. If the only people present are [[Justice Task Force Member (blue Archive)|]] mob characters, don't use this tag.

h4. Members

h6. Executive

* [[Tsurugi (blue archive)|]]
* [[Hasumi (blue archive)|]]

h6. Regular Members

* [[Mashiro (blue archive)|]]
* [[Ichika (blue archive)|]]
* [[Koharu (blue archive)|]]

title: justice_task_force_member_(blue_archive)
body:
A nameless female mob unit in [[Blue Archive]] who serves as a part of Trinity General School's [[Justice Task Force (blue archive)|]]. Despite her lack of distinctive characteristics she's managed to garner quite a following. For short she may be called 正実モブ ([i]Seiji Mobu[/i], "JTF Mob") or affectionately as モブちゃん ([i]Mob-chan[/i]).

The named members of the [[Justice Task Force (blue archive)|]] (with the exception of [[Koharu (blue archive)|]]) all share certain character design elements in common with Mob-chan. [[Ichika (blue archive)|]] is particularly close to them, both in terms of appearance and being most likely to interact directly with them. This has lead to a common joke that Mob-chan represents a "base form" that the other members have "evolved" from. As of Ichika's recent release, these mobs have [[red eyes]].

Carries either an [[EM-2]] or an [[L85]]-style [[assault rifle]].
other_names: 正義実現委員会のモブ

The head government of Trinity General School, lead by the triumvirate of [[Nagisa (blue archive)|]], [[Seia (blue archive)|]], and [[Mika (blue archive)|]]. Each member represents one of the three major factions that founded Trinity: Pater, Filius, and Sanctus.

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.

body:
The [b]Hyakkaryouran Resolution Council[/b] or Hyakkaryouran for short, is one of the many school clubs from [[Blue Archive]].

A club from Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy, the Hyakkaryouran have serve as the peacekeepers of Hyakkiyako since the Academy's founding. Hyakkaryouran members wear a sky-blue [[haori]] with white five-petaled flowers emblazoned across their sleeves and use Type 38 Arisaka Rifle.

title: cleaning_&_clearing_(blue_archive)
body:
In [[Blue Archive]], Cleaning & Clearing (C＆C) is one of the clubs at Millennium Science School.

Officially, C&C is a simple [[maid]] club. In reality, the club is Millennium's elite special operations unit, tasked with removing any potential threats to the school. As a result, they often work in conjunction with the school's student council, [[Seminar (blue archive)|]].

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus, with the exception of [[Toki (blue archive)|Asuma Toki]], as she did not appear in the story as a member initially.

title: game_development_department_(blue_archive)
body:
In [[Blue Archive]], Game Development Department is one of the clubs at Millennium Science School.

In contrast to their school's motto, this Department is focused on making retro-styled games; one can mistake it for a typical gaming club.

This club is the main focus of the Millennium Arc, Clockwork Flower Pavane. During the arc, the club is in danger of being dissolved due to A.) only having three members and B.) not having made any notable accomplishments throughout the school year. They often clash with [[Yuuka (blue archive)|]] due to the club's issues.

Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.

title: oju_chosan_(racehorse)
body:
Retired Japanese race [[horse]]. He is the highest earning steeplechase race horse in the world, with an astounding 6 wins at the Nakayama Grand Jump, the last of them winning just 13 days after his 11th birthday.

While the horse, or steeplechase racing in general, has not made an appearance in [[Umamusume]], fan artists tend to depict an OC-version of the horse hanging around with [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]] and other [[Stay Gold (racehorse)|]]-related characters, as Oju is sired by Stay Gold (and shared temperment issues in real life).

title: soka_gakkai_international
body:
A modern Japan-based international lay religious movement which based itself in the Shōshū sect of Nichiren Buddhism. Originally founded in the early 1930s, it was disbanded following suppression by Japan's wartime government before reorganizing in 1946. In 1991, they were excommunicated from Nichiren Shōshū over doctrinal disputes.

It is often labeled a cult by critics both in Japan and from abroad due to the significant emphasis on praising its current president [[Ikeda Daisaku]], as well the involvement of its members and leadership in notable incidents involving aggressive proselytization, violent encounters with Buddhist clergy, political posturing through the Komeito Party, and for fostering other dubious associations, such as with the late ex-Panamanian dictator [[Manuel Noriega]].

Media appearances featuring prominent members such as actress [[Hisamoto Masami]] became the [[meme]] [[Atama Ga Paan (meme)|]] on [[niconico|Nico Nico Douga]] when they were used as sources for MAD movies.
